prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Will:
No, it's okay. This is the real me. When I got the part of the Steel Samurai, with that mask...
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor old Hammer and the rest had been doing a run-through there since the morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: I, well, I had some errands to run that morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, it was 1:00 when I got to the guard station.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was at the main gate from then until 5:00!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 5
Testimony: Now, the murder happened at 2:30 PM, right?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 6
Testimony: Interesting to me, because a certain man walked right by me at 2:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 7
Testimony: It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!
Person: Oldbag

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The user has provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair where they don't align.

First, let me go through the testimonies and see what each one says. The testimonies here are from the Security Lady (Oldbag). Let me look at her statements:

Testimony 0: She arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Testimony 1: Jack and others were doing a run-through since the morning.
Testimony 2: She had errands in the morning.
Testimony 3: Repeats she was at the guard station from 1:00 PM.
Testimony 4: She was there until 5:00 PM.
Testimony 5: Confirms the murder was at 2:30 PM.
Testimony 6: At 2:00 PM, a man (Powers) walked by heading to the studio.
Testimony 7: Identifies the man as Powers going toward the studio.

Now, looking at the evidences. Let me check each one to see if any conflict with the testimonies. Let's go through them:

Evidence 5: Powers'(?) Photo. The description says it was taken at the gate on Oct 15, 2:00 PM. The caption mentions Steel Samurai (Powers) is seen walking, dragging one leg. The photo is Photo #2. The note from Will (Powers) says it's him in the mask. So this photo shows Powers at the gate at 2:00 PM, which matches Testimony 6 and 7 where the Security Lady saw him at 2:00 PM going toward the studio. So that's consistent, not a contradiction.

Evidence 15: Cody's Camera. The description says Cody always carries it but is learning to use it. Not sure how this connects yet.

Evidence 16: Steak Plate with sleeping pills and a bone. The victim's autopsy (Evidence 3) says he was killed at 2:30 PM. If the plate has sleeping pills, maybe related to how Jack was drugged? Not sure yet.

Evidence 4: Cardkey for Studio One. If someone needed a cardkey, maybe the Security Lady's testimony about Powers entering the studio at 2:00 PM would require him to have a cardkey. But the testimony says she saw him heading there, not necessarily entering. Maybe not a direct contradiction.

Evidence 11: Mr. Monkey's Head blocked the path between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM. If the path was blocked from 2:15 onwards, then someone couldn't have passed through that path after 2:15. The Security Lady says Powers was seen at 2:00 PM heading toward the studio. If the studio is beyond the blocked path, then if the path was blocked starting at 2:15, Powers couldn't have gotten through after that. But he was seen at 2:00, which is before the blockage. So maybe not a contradiction.

Wait, the Monkey's Head blocked the path from 2:15 to 4:00. So if Powers was heading toward the studio at 2:00, he would have had to go through the path before 2:15. If the murder happened at 2:30, then perhaps he was stopped by the blockage. But the Security Lady's testimony doesn't mention that. Hmm, maybe not a direct contradiction here.

Looking at Evidence 5 again. The photo was taken at 2:00 PM, showing Powers at the gate. The Security Lady also saw him at 2:00 PM. That's consistent, so no contradiction there.

Wait, but the testimony says Powers was heading toward the studio. The photo shows him at the gate, so that's consistent with moving towards the studio. So that's okay.

Now, looking at Evidence 18: Van used by Manella to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer. The time isn't specified here, but maybe related to alibis.

Evidence 7: Empty Sleeping Pill Bottle with Jack's fingerprints. If Jack had taken sleeping pills, maybe he was drugged, but the murder was at 2:30. The Steak Plate (Evidence 16) has sleeping pills and a bone, so maybe Jack ate the steak with pills. But how does that relate to testimony?

Looking at Testimony 6 and 7 from the Security Lady: She saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading to the studio. The murder was at 2:30. So if Powers was seen entering the studio area at 2:00, he could have been there when the murder happened. But maybe the evidence contradicts that?

Wait, Evidence 11: Mr. Monkey's Head blocked the path from 2:15 to 4:00. If the path to the studio was blocked starting at 2:15, then Powers couldn't have gotten to the studio after 2:15. The Security Lady saw him at 2:00, but if the path was blocked by 2:15, he couldn't have reached the studio in time. So the murder was at 2:30, so if the path was blocked, he couldn't have been there. But the Security Lady says he was heading toward the studio, implying he was going to get there. That's a contradiction between the testimony (he was heading there at 2:00) and the evidence (the path was blocked from 2:15, so he couldn't have gotten there by 2:30). Wait, but if he was seen at 2:00, he could have arrived before 2:15. Let me check the timeline.

The blockage started at 2:15. If Powers was heading towards the studio at 2:00, he might have reached before 2:15. The murder was at 2:30, so if he was already there before 2:15, then the blockage wouldn't stop him. But the Security Lady was at the gate until 5:00, so maybe she saw him enter before the blockage. So that's okay. Hmm, maybe not a contradiction.

Wait, maybe Evidence 11's blockage is the path to the crime scene, not the studio entrance. The description says "blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM." The scene is Studio One where Jack was killed. So if the path to the scene was blocked from 2:15, then Powers couldn't have gotten there after 2:15. But he was seen at 2:00 heading towards the studio. If he was there before 2:15, he could have committed the murder at 2:30? No, because the blockage would prevent anyone from leaving or entering the scene's path after 2:15. Wait, the blockage is from 2:15 to 4:00. So if the murder happened at 2:30, and the path was blocked, then someone couldn't have entered or left the scene after 2:15. So if Powers was seen at 2:00 heading there, he could have arrived before 2:15, but after that, the path was blocked. So he could be inside, but the Security Lady's testimony says he was heading there at 2:00, which would mean he was on his way, but couldn't get through the blockage. Wait, maybe the path was blocked, so even if he was going there at 2:00, he couldn't reach the scene after 2:15. So if the murder was at 2:30, he would have had to be there before 2:15, but that's possible. Hmm, maybe this isn't a contradiction.

Alternatively, maybe the path being blocked means that the Security Lady couldn't have seen him entering after 2:15, but she saw him at 2:00, so that's okay.

Hmm, maybe I need to look elsewhere. Let me check other testimonies and evidences.

Looking at Evidence 5 again. The photo was taken at 2:00 PM, showing Powers at the gate. The Security Lady also saw him at that time. So that's consistent.

Wait, the Security Lady was at the guard station from 1:00 to 5:00. The path was blocked from 2:15, but she was still at the guard station. Maybe she couldn't see beyond the blockage? Or maybe the blockage was on the path she was guarding, meaning she couldn't let anyone through after 2:15. But the photo shows him at the gate (the entrance) at 2:00, so he passed through before the blockage.

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me check other evidences.

Evidence 16: Steak Plate with sleeping pills and a bone. The victim's autopsy (Evidence 3) says he was killed at 2:30 PM. If the plate has sleeping pills with his fingerprints, maybe he ate the steak with pills, which could have been a way to incapacitate him. But how does that contradict a testimony?

The Security Lady's testimonies don't mention anything about pills. Maybe not directly.

Wait, Testimony 7 says the Security Lady saw Powers heading toward the studio. If the studio requires a cardkey (Evidence 4), then perhaps Powers had one. But the cardkey is just an evidence, not necessarily proving he had it. The Security Lady's testimony doesn't mention the cardkey, so maybe no contradiction.

Hmm. Let me think again. The user's previous examples had contradictions where a testimony and evidence directly contradicted each other. For instance, in an earlier case, a testimony said the victim ran to the left, but evidence said the autopsy showed instantaneous death so they couldn't run.

In this case, perhaps Evidence 11 (Mr. Monkey's Head blocking the path from 2:15 to 4:00) and Testimony 6/7 (Security Lady saw Powers at 2:00 heading to the studio). If the path was blocked from 2:15, then Powers couldn't have gotten to the studio after that time. But the murder was at 2:30. If the path was blocked from 2:15, then Powers couldn't have gotten there after that. However, the Security Lady saw him at 2:00, so he could have arrived before the blockage. Therefore, he could have been in the studio by 2:15, and then the murder happened at 2:30. But the blockage might prevent others from entering or leaving, but the murderer could still be inside. So maybe that's not a contradiction.

Alternatively, perhaps the path being blocked means that the Security Lady couldn't have seen anyone entering after 2:15. But she was at the guard station from 1:00 to 5:00, so she would have seen Powers at 2:00, before the blockage. So that's okay.

Hmm, maybe I'm missing something. Let's check another angle.

Looking at Evidence 15: Cody's Camera. The testimony doesn't mention Cody, so not sure.

Evidence 17: Five-Year-Old Photo of Jack's accident. Maybe related to motive, but not a direct contradiction.

Evidence 14: "Path to Glory" with photos of Steel Samurai's victories. Not sure.

Wait, Testimony 2 says the Security Lady had errands in the morning. Testimony 3 says she was at the guard station from 1:00. That's consistent.

Evidence 5's photo is from 2:00, which matches Testimony 6's time. So that's okay.

Wait a minute. The Security Lady's Testimony 6 says she saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading toward the studio. But Evidence 5's photo shows him at the gate at 2:00 PM. The gate is the entrance, so heading toward the studio would mean he was passing through the gate. But if the path was blocked from 2:15, then after that time, the path to the studio was blocked. So he could have passed through the gate before 2:15, but the blockage is on the path to the crime scene (Studio One). Therefore, maybe the blockage is on the path from the gate to the studio. If so, then Powers could have passed the gate at 2:00 but couldn't proceed to the studio because the path was blocked after 2:15. Wait, but the blockage starts at 2:15, so he could have gotten to the studio before that time. So if he was seen at 2:00, he could have arrived at the studio by 2:15, then the blockage would prevent others from coming in, but he was already there.

Alternatively, maybe the blockage is on the exit path, so once someone is inside, they can't leave. But the murder is at 2:30, so Powers could have been there, committed the murder, and then couldn't leave because the path was blocked. But the Security Lady didn't see him leaving, so that's possible.

Hmm, not seeing a contradiction here. Maybe I'm missing another piece.

Wait, Testimony 7 says the Security Lady saw Powers heading toward the studio. If Evidence 11's blockage was in effect from 2:15, then the path to the studio was blocked after that time. But the Security Lady was at the guard station until 5:00. If the path was blocked, she wouldn't have seen anyone passing through after 2:15. But she saw Powers at 2:00, so that's okay. But if someone else tried to enter after 2:15, she wouldn't have seen them. So no contradiction here.

Hmm, maybe looking at another testimony and evidence pair.

Evidence 16: Steak Plate with sleeping pills. If the victim had taken the pills, maybe he was asleep or incapacitated, making the murder easier. But the autopsy says death was by the spear. The pills might have been a method to drug him. But how does that contradict a testimony?

The Security Lady's testimonies don't mention anything about the pills. So maybe not.

Wait, Testimony 1 says the victim and others were doing a run-through since the morning. If they were there all morning, maybe Powers was part of that, but the testimony says he was seen at 2:00 PM. Not sure.

Evidence 7: Empty Sleeping Pill Bottle with Jack's fingerprints. If Jack had taken pills, maybe he was alone when he took them. But the Security Lady's testimony doesn't conflict with that.

Hmm, this is tricky. Maybe I need to consider another angle.

Looking back at Evidence 5 again. The photo shows Powers at the gate at 2:00 PM. The Security Lady also saw him there. That's consistent. So that's not a contradiction.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Look pal, that camera takes a picture automatically whenever someone walks by.
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The time of poor Hammer's death was 2:30 PM, true?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: The only person I saw go to the studio before then was Will Powers!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: No one else went there!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: If they had, I would have seen them!
Person: Oldbag

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a contradiction between one evidence and one testimony from the provided list. Let me start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony carefully.

First, the characters involved here include Security Lady (Character 4, Oldbag), who claims she was at the main gate from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM. Her testimonies are Testimony 0 to Testimony 3. 

Looking at the testimonies:

Testimony 0: Oldbag states the time of death was 2:30 PM. That's just confirming the autopsy report, so that's probably consistent with Evidence 3 (Jack's Autopsy Report) which says the time of death is 2:30 PM. So no contradiction there.

Testimony 1: "The only person I saw go to the studio before then was Will Powers!" (Testimony 1). Here, "before then" refers to before 2:30 PM. She says no one else went to the studio except Powers before the murder.

Testimony 2: "No one else went there!" reinforcing Testimony 1.

Testimony 3: "If they had, I would have seen them!" which again supports her claim that she saw everyone who went through the gate.

Now, looking at the evidences, especially Evidence 11: Mr. Monkey's Head, which blocked the path to the scene between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM. Wait, if the path was blocked from 2:15 PM onwards, that means after 2:15 PM, no one could go through that path. But the murder happened at 2:30 PM. 

But the key point here is that the Security Lady was at the gate from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM. If the path was blocked starting at 2:15 PM, then anyone trying to go to the studio after that time would have to take a different route, or maybe the blockage is on the path she was guarding? The description says "blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM." 

If the path was blocked from 2:15 PM, then after that time, the Security Lady couldn't have seen people going to the studio via that path. But her testimony (Testimony 1 and 2) claims that the only person she saw before 2:30 PM (the time of death) was Powers. However, if the path was blocked starting at 2:15 PM, then between 2:15 and 2:30 PM, the path was blocked, so anyone trying to go to the studio after 2:15 would have to find another way, which might not go through the main gate she was monitoring. 

Wait, but the murder happened at 2:30 PM. If the path was blocked from 2:15 to 4 PM, then between 2:15 and 2:30, the path was blocked. So, if someone wanted to get to the studio after 2:15, they might have to take a different route that doesn't go through the main gate. Therefore, the Security Lady, who was at the main gate from 1 PM to 5 PM, wouldn't have seen anyone going through that gate after 2:15 if they took an alternative route. 

However, Testimony 1 says she saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading to the studio (as per previous testimonies, like Testimony 7 in the previous problem where she said Powers passed by at 2:00 PM). But between 2:15 and 2:30, the path was blocked, so maybe Powers arrived before the blockage. However, the contradiction might be that if the path was blocked from 2:15, then anyone arriving after that time couldn't have gone through the blocked path, but the Security Lady's testimony claims that no one else went to the studio before 2:30 except Powers. But if the path was blocked after 2:15, perhaps someone could have come before that, but the testimony says no one else went before 2:30. Wait, maybe the Security Lady's testimony says that between 1 PM to 5 PM, she was at the gate, so she should have seen everyone entering through the main gate. But if the path was blocked at 2:15, maybe the blockage was on another path, not the main gate. Alternatively, maybe the blockage was on the path leading to the studio, so after 2:15, people couldn't reach the studio via that path, but could come through another entrance that the Security Lady wasn't monitoring. 

Alternatively, if the Mr. Monkey's Head blocked the path to the scene (the studio), then anyone going to the studio after 2:15 would have to take a different route that might not pass the Security Lady's gate. Therefore, someone could have gone to the studio after 2:15 without being seen by the Security Lady, contradicting her testimony that no one else went there before 2:30. 

Wait, the murder was at 2:30. The path was blocked until 4 PM, so between 2:15 and 2:30, the path was blocked, so the only way to get there would be an alternative route. Therefore, someone could have come between 2:15 and 2:30 via another path, which the Security Lady wouldn't have seen because they didn't go through her gate. Therefore, her testimony that "no one else went there" (to the studio) before 2:30 might be contradicted by the existence of an alternative path that allowed entry without passing her gate after 2:15. 

Therefore, Evidence 11 (Mr. Monkey's Head blocking the path from 2:15 to 4 PM) contradicts Testimony 1 (Oldbag's claim that no one else went to the studio before 2:30 except Powers). Because the blockage would allow someone to enter after 2:15 via another route without being seen by the Security Lady, meaning she couldn't have seen everyone, contradicting her testimony that she would have seen anyone else. 

Alternatively, maybe the blockage itself is a physical obstruction that would have been there when the Security Lady was at the gate, so if the path was blocked, she would know that no one could have gone through that path after 2:15, but the testimony says she saw no one else except Powers before 2:30. However, the contradiction is that the blockage was in place during part of the time she was on duty, so her testimony that she saw everyone is undermined because the blockage might have allowed someone to come in another way that she didn't observe. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 11 and Testimony 1 (Testimony 1's statement that no one else went there except Powers before 2:30 is contradicted by the possibility of someone taking an alternative path after 2:15 that the Security Lady didn't see, due to the blockage).
